meanings.definition: Cause a severe loss in the dignity of and respect for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His rude behavior seemed to demean the entire team.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to demean herself by participating in the gossip.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to demean the dog by stealing its toy was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction seemed to demean the once majestic trees.
meanings.sent5: The villain's evil plan was designed to demean the hero in front of everyone.

meanings.definition: Lower oneself in dignity or character.
meanings.sent1: He didn't want to demean himself by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: She felt she had to demean herself to fit in with the popular crowd.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's self-deprecating jokes never failed to demean his own image.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to demean his own work by selling it at a low price.
meanings.sent5: The politician's scandalous actions seemed to demean his reputation beyond repair.
